title: Reading
summary: Discover why reading matters, explore genres, practice finding reliable info, stay safe online, and complete a reading-focused service project.

resources.title: How to Choose a Book
resources.description: Quick tips for finding books you’ll enjoy.

resources.title: CrashCourse: How and Why We Read (video)
resources.description: Short explainer on the power of reading.

modules.title: Why Read?
modules.prompt: In 2–3 minutes (text or audio), describe what you want reading to do for you this year.

modules.title: Reading for Fun
modules.instructions: Log 4+ books across different types/genres. For each: title, author, pages, why you chose it, 3–5 sentence takeaway.

modules.title: Using the Library
modules.instructions: Do an Author, Title, and Subject search; record one call number and shelf location.

modules.title: Reading for Information
modules.instructions: Find 3+ sources in mixed formats. Submit a one-page summary plus 1–2 credibility notes per source.

quiz.q: True/False: Share your last name at will on public sites.

choices: Keep private; share only with parent/guardian
quiz.a: Keep private; share only with parent/guardian

quiz.q: A stranger asks to meet to trade books. What do you do?
quiz.a: Decline and tell a parent/guardian; never meet without family approval.

modules.title: Volunteering for Reading
modules.instructions: ≥4 hours. Options: read-aloud, help library, book drive, Little Free Library. Log hours + photo/note.
